args.natural_language_statement: Translate: If a group Γ has a covering action on a simply connected and locally simply connected Hausdorff topological space Y, then the quotient map p : Y → Γ \ Y =: X is a universal covering map, so there is a group isomorphism π_1(X) ≅ Γ. {"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Limits Functor PreGaloisCategory
open scoped FundamentalGroupoid
open CategoryTheory

/-- Translate: If a group Γ has a covering action on a simply connected and locally simply connected Hausdorff topological space Y, then the quotient map p : Y → Γ \ Y =: X is a universal covering map, so there is a group isomorphism π_1(X) ≅ Γ. Provide a Lean4 translation that imports Mathlib and ends the theorem with := by sorry. Use placeholders if

args.content:
import Mathlib

universe u

-- Placeholder definitions to represent the topological and covering-space notions
-- used in the informal statement. We create minimal types/props so the statement
-- can be expressed in Lean without relying on particular Mathlib lemmas.

variable {Γ : Type u} [Group Γ]

class simply_connected (X : Type u) [TopologicalSpace X] : Prop :=
  (out : Prop)

class locally_simply_connected (X : Type u) [TopologicalSpace X] : Prop :=
  (out : Prop)

class hausdorff_space (X : Type u) [TopologicalSpace X] : Prop :=
  (out : Prop)

/-- A very small placeholder for a covering action of a group Γ on a space Y. -/
structure covering_action (Γ : Type u) [Group Γ] (Y : Type u) [TopologicalSpace Y] : Prop :=
(action : Γ → Y → Y)
(is_covering_action : Prop)

/-- Placeholder for the notion that a map p : Y → X is a universal covering map. -/
def IsUniversalCoveringMap {Y X : Type u} [TopologicalSpace Y] [TopologicalSpace X] (p : Y → X) : Prop :=
  True

/-- Placeholder for the fundamental group at a basepoint. -/
constant pi1 : (X : Type u) → (X → Prop) → Type u

/-- A very small representation of a group isomorphism (not asserting group homomorphism laws).
    This is just a placeholder so we can state the existence of an isomorphism. -/
structure GroupIso (G H : Type u) [Group G] [Group H] : Type u :=
  (toEquiv : G ≃ H)

/-- The translated statement:

If a group Γ has a covering action on a simply connected and locally simply connected
Hausdorff topological space Y, then the quotient map p : Y → Γ \ Y =: X is a universal
covering map, so there is a group isomorphism π_1(X) ≃ Γ.

This is stated using placeholders for the involved topological concepts; the proof is omitted. -/
theorem covering_action_gives_universal_cover
  {Y : Type u} [TopologicalSpace Y]
  (h_sc : simply_connected Y) (h_lsc : locally_simply_connected Y) (h_haus : hausdorff_space Y)
  (h_act : covering_action Γ Y) :
  ∃ (X : Type u) (p : Y → X) (x0 : X), IsUniversalCoveringMap (p) ∧ Nonempty (GroupIso (pi1 X (fun _ => True)) Γ) :=
  by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

universe u

variable {Γ : Type u} [Group Γ]

-- Placeholder for "locally simply connected"; mathlib may not expose this exact name,
-- so we introduce a lightweight class to express the hypothesis.
class LocallySimplyConnected (X : Type u) [TopologicalSpace X] : Prop :=

/-- Placeholder class saying the Γ-action on Y is a covering action. We only need it
    as a hypothesis to state the theorem; the proof is omitted. -/
class IsCoveringAction (Γ : Type u) [Group Γ] (Y : Type u) [TopologicalSpace Y] [MulAction Γ Y] : Prop :=

/-- If a group Γ has a covering action on a simply connected and locally simply connected
Hausdorff topological space Y, then the quotient map p : Y → Γ \ Y =: X is a universal
covering map, so there is a group isomorphism π_1(X) ≃ Γ.

The statement below uses placeholders for the "locally simply connected" and
"covering action" hypotheses; the proof is omitted (":= by sorry"). -/
theorem covering_action_yields_universal_cover
  {Y : Type u} [TopologicalSpace Y] [T2Space Y] [SimplyConnectedSpace Y] [LocallySimplyConnected Y]
  [MulAction Γ Y] [IsCoveringAction Γ Y] :
  ∃ (X : Type u) (instX : TopologicalSpace X) (p : Y → X) (x0 : X),
    IsCoveringMap (p) ∧ Nonempty (FundamentalGroup X x0 ≃ Γ) := by
  sorry
